lines.content: Welcome to **Nimbus**, a lightweight CLI task manager (inspired by the Duke project) that helps you track tasks quickly from the terminal. Nimbus supports adding tasks, listing them, and marking/unmarking completion ‚Äî with a clean, consistent text UI.
- `unmark <index>` ‚Äî mark a task as not done
Nimbus prints responses in a consistent ‚Äúboxed‚Äù format for readability.
> Note: Nimbus is currently a **CLI (text UI)** application. Features like GUI and auto-saving should only be listed if you have implemented them.
1. Open the project folder in IntelliJ.
(Your original template instructions were here ‚Äî you can keep or delete that section depending on how ‚Äúpersonal‚Äù you want the README to be.)
Template reminder: keep `src/main/java` as the root folder for Java files. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}
### Run from Terminal (if Gradle wrapper exists)
* Entry point and main runtime loop for the Nimbus task-tracking application.
* Nimbus reads commands from the user via {@link Ui}, parses them into {@link Command}
* objects via {@link Parser}, executes them against the {@link TaskList}, and persists
* Constructs a Nimbus instance and loads any previously saved tasks from the given file path.
* @param filePath Path to the save file (e.g. {@code "data/nimbus.txt"}).
ui.showError("Could not load save file. Starting with an empty list.");
* Runs the main application loop until an exit command is received.
* Each iteration reads a command, parses it, executes it, and attempts to save.
ui.showError("Could not save to file. Your changes may not persist.");

* Indicates that the program should exit after executing this command.
* Represents an executable user command in Nimbus.
* Each {@code Command} performs an operation on the application's {@link TaskList}
* and uses {@link Ui} to display feedback to the user.
* @param tasks The task list to operate on.
* @param ui    The UI used to show messages to the user.
* @throws NimbusException If execution fails due to invalid inputs or application constraints.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws NimbusException;
* Returns whether this command signals the program to exit.
* @return {@code true} if the program should exit after executing this command; {@code false} otherwise.

* @param ui    The UI used to show feedback.
* @throws NimbusException If the index is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws NimbusException {

* Represents an application-level error in Nimbus, typically caused by invalid user input
* Constructs a NimbusException with the specified message.
* @param message Error message to show to the user.
* Provides centralized utility methods for parsing and formatting {@link LocalDateTime} objects.

*

This class ensures that date-time strings entered by the user, stored in data files,
* or displayed in the UI maintain a consistent format across the Nimbus application.
* It supports ISO-8601 formats, custom user input patterns, and date-only inputs.
/** * Pattern for date-only user input: {@code yyyy-MM-dd} (e.g., 2019-12-02).
// Add this for your Storage file
/** * Pattern for date and time user input: {@code yyyy-MM-dd HHmm} (e.g., 2019-12-02 1800).
/** * Pattern for date-only display output: {@code MMM dd yyyy} (e.g., Dec 02 2019).
/** * Pattern for date and time display output: {@code MMM dd yyyy, h:mm a} (e.g., Dec 02 2019, 6:00 PM).
* Parses a string representation of a date and/or time into a {@link LocalDateTime} object.

* *

The method attempts to parse the input in the following order of precedence:

*
  • User Date-Time: If the string contains a space (e.g., {@code 2019-12-02 1800}).

*
  • User Date-Only: Defaults to the start of the day (e.g., {@code 2019-12-02}).
* @param raw The raw input string to be parsed.
* @return A {@link LocalDateTime} object representing the input string.
* @throws NimbusException If the input is {@code null}, blank, or does not match any
public static LocalDateTime parseDateTime(String raw) throws NimbusException {
throw new NimbusException("Date/time cannot be empty.");
